content.content: Retroactive Delegate Rewards for Season 1 & 2 The Optimism Foundation recognizes the incredible work Token House delegates have put in over the last six months. The workload for delegates was very intense and we appreciate your dedication, feedback, and willingness to iterate. In recognition of this work, the Foundation will retroactively reward the top active delegates from Seasons 1 & 2.  Delegates with >0.5% voting power are eligible to receive 10,500 OP, if they meet the below criteria. Delegates with >0.25% but <0.5% voting power are eligible to receive 8,000 OP, if they meet the below criteria. These criteria, while imperfect, attempt to take into account a delegate’s reputation, voting participation, and voting quality. Please remember this criteria is only being used for Season 2 and is likely to change in the future Seasons as governance evolves.  Untitled1003×523 49.2 KB  note: snapshot as of 11/11/22 Qualifying delegates:  OPSNXambassadors.eth (problems voting are well documented, but some examples are here and here) lindajxie.eth polynya.eth Quix lefteris.eth katiegarcia.eth ceresstation.eth griff.eth gfxlabs.eth (problems voting documented here) flipsidecrypto.eth Sugma.eth solarcurve.eth UPennBlockchain.eth MinimalGravitas.eth joxes.defilatam.eth butterbum.eth dhannte.eth ScaleWeb3.eth/superdelegate.eth (address change documented here) hailvitalik.eth stablenodegov.eth  If you were prevented from fulfilling the voting participation criteria due to third-party application errors, please DM lavande#3900 with evidence of your participation (transaction hashes, etc.) by end of day Monday, November 21st If you met the quality approximation criteria but were not added to the list because forum name(s) do not clearly tie to your on-chain address, please DM lavande#3900 by end of day Monday, November 21st  In addition to the above rewards, 4,000 OP will be distributed to each member of Shadow Committee B, in recognition of their contributions during Season 2.  Untitled (1)1002×151 15 KB  Shadow Committee B members:  jackanorak.eth Mastermojo Matt L Sugma.eth solarcurve.eth  Consistent with other grant distributions, delegate rewards will be subject to a KYC and claims flow process.  In Season 3, rewards will be pre-defined for all Council positions, if the Grants Council is approved.  All other delegate rewards will continue to be allocated retroactively. As Collective governance processes are still highly experimental, there may be large shifts in delegate responsibility and activity levels between Seasons. Distributing rewards retroactively allows for flexibility in the face of this high variability. Once governance has stabilized, an ongoing delegate rewards policy may be implemented, subject to a governance vote. This round of retroactive delegate rewards will be allocated from the “Unallocated” portion of the Ecosystem Fund, not the Governance Fund (and is therefore not subject to Token House approval). Delegates are a critical part of Optimism governance. Without delegates, we cannot effectively translate individual needs and wants into Collective action. We know participating in Token House governance requires a serious time commitment and are beyond grateful for your engagement in governance, as it benefits the whole Collective.
content.GPT-summary: The post explains that the Optimism Foundation will retroactively reward the top active delegates from Seasons 1 & 2. The criteria for eligibility are based on a delegate's reputation, voting participation, and voting quality. The post also mentions that rewards will be subject to a KYC and claims flow process and that an ongoing delegate rewards policy may be implemented in the future. The post does not ask for feedback, but it extends gratitude to the delegates for their engagement in governance.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: This will be challenging to determine top active delegates from Seasons 1 and 2, as alot of stuff was done in DMs and other discord channels. You can get an idea of active delegates though by looking at cycle round ups:     Voting Cycle #8: Roundup Voting Cycles       Voting Cycle 8 began on Thursday (October 20th) at 12pm PST / 7pm GMT and runs until Wednesday (November 9th) at 12pm PST / 7pm GMT.  A snapshot of delegate voting weights was taken at the start of the Voting Cycle. Voting will take place via Snapshot during Week 3 of the Voting Cycle. The OP Votable Supply on the first day of this cycle was 24,736,433.  For a detailed breakdown of the governance and voting process, please see the Operating Manual . content.content: We received a grant in season-2 to build Delegate dashboard which shows delegate activity. We index delegate activity across snapshot, forum and discord. We can segment the data by season to understand delegate activity in voting, forum and so on. If we can be of any help, let me know. You can see the delegate dashboard here https://optimism.showkarma.xyz/
198 seems like a decent threshold
Nice tool. My off-chain voting is in the 99th percentile

Nice tool! One major thing the tool is not capturing is the wallets that could not vote for multiple seasons (Ex: The Synthetix Ambassadors). Though, their activity can be track by looking through the discord channels, OP forums, looking at the Voting Cycle Summaries, and talking to the protocols. ALOT of work has been put into Optimism Governance. I also think the Defi Shadow Committee should be considered here, I know first hand the time Commitment put into it reviews (@jackanorak was a great committee lead).

It seems that a reasonable reward was given to those who worked hard!  I will always support you.
Wow! Thanks! what a pleasant surprise. One question, how much OP is considered the “votable supply”?
Votable supply is the total amount of delegated OP, for reference see Optimism | OP Token House - Delegate Voting Weight Tracker 🔴🏛
This sounds like a great way to incentivise being active in governance!

Hi everyone! Consistent with other distributions, delegates receiving retroactive rewards will need to KYC. This information will be collected privately by the Foundation. If you have not already KYC’d with the Foundation, please message me privately with the best point of contact information and @PalashOP will reach out with additional details.
This is very good! looking forward to hearing more.
